snippet: At Liebman’s Kosher Delicatessen in the Bronx they’ve been slinging pastrami and brisket since 1953, and no one seems to care about New York’s deli resurgence, or think that it needed one in the first place.
abstract: Neighborhood Joint column on Liebman's Delicatessen, traditional Jewish delicatessen in Riverdale section of Bronx; deli is one of two such establishments that has remained in area since 1950s.
lead_paragraph: At Liebman’s Kosher Delicatessen in the Bronx they’ve been slinging pastrami and brisket since 1953, and no one seems to care about New York’s deli resurgence, or think that it needed one in the first place.

headline.seo: An Old-School Deli Endures in the Bronx
